meanings.definition: A person or thing that pastes.
meanings.sent1: The pasters in the art class helped stick the pictures on the board.
meanings.sent2: I need some pasters to help me glue these papers together.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought it was a good idea to become a paster and stick its toys to the wall.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like pasters, carefully piecing together the broken hearts of her friends.
meanings.sent5: The diligent student was known as the paster of the class, always ready with glue for any project.

meanings.definition: A small piece of paper, especially one that has been cut from a larger sheet, that is used to cover a hole or mark a place.
meanings.sent1: She used pasters to cover up the mistakes in her drawing.
meanings.sent2: The teacher handed out colorful pasters for the students to use in their workbooks.
meanings.sent3: The pasters on the map were like tiny flags marking the places they had visited.
meanings.sent4: His words were like pasters, covering up the truth with pretty lies.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully selected the perfect paster to highlight the focal point of her masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A person who pastes up bills or posters.
meanings.sent1: The paster was busy putting up advertisements all over the town.
meanings.sent2: We need to hire a new paster for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: The paster accidentally glued his own hand to the wall while putting up the poster.
meanings.sent4: She was a paster of dreams, spreading hope with every poster she hung.
meanings.sent5: The diligent paster made sure every corner of the city was covered with announcements.
